ProductOverview.Summary: Tupaia is an end-to-end data platform that supports data aggregation, analysis, and visualisation for mapping health systems in low- and middle-income countries
ProductOverview.Description: Tupaia is used to complement other systems such as DHIS2 and mSupply, utilising several powerful features such as a data broker that is able to seamlessly consume and route data from multiple sources, the ability to support multiple data platforms, and a highly attractive GIS platform around which the visualisations are built. Tupaia is completely free and open-source.  We combine data from multiple sources including DHIS2, mSupply, Kobo, Tamanu, and our own MediTrak app to help improve medicines' availability, map disease outbreaks, map public health programming, undertake disease surveillance, respond to disasters, and strengthen service provision.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Health information system for Pacific Island nations with offline capabilities
ProductOverview.Users: Healthcare workers and donors from low- and middle-income settings.

Reach.SummaryOfReach: Used in 14 countries in the Indo-Pacific region

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.  The scores for Inclusive Design, Climate Resilience and Low Carbon are not available as this assessment was done using the previous version of the maturity model.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: Tupaia is developed and maintained by Beyond Essential Systems with support from the Pacific Island health community.

HostAnchorOrganization.name: Beyond Essential Systems
HostAnchorOrganization.description: Health technology company focused on Pacific Island nations

collectionInitiative.label: DIAL Exchange
collectionInitiative.description: A platform by the Digital Impact Alliance to connect digital public goods and solutions for global development.
